===Candidate ban===
===Candidate ban===
{{expand section|date=November 2010}}
{{expand section|date=November 2010}}
â
The ruling National Democratic Party (NDP)'s recent decision to ban three of its parliamentary candidates from standing in 28 November elections has kicked up a storm of speculation.
+
The ruling National Democratic Party (''NDP'')'s recent decision to ban three of its parliamentary candidates from standing in ''2010 parliamentary election'' has kicked up a storm of speculation<ref name="NDP's pro-Gamal Mubarak candidates banned from parliamentary polls">[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/ndps-pro-gamal-mubarak-candidates-banned-parliamentary-polls NDP's pro-Gamal Mubarak candidates banned from parliamentary polls]</ref>.
â
The three candidates to be banned are Daker Abdel Lah, who had been running for the professional seats in Manshiet Nasser and Gamaliya; Islam Medhat, who had been running for the professional seats in the Abdeen and Moski constituencies; and Ayman Taha, who had been running for seats reserved for workers in the Bolak Abu al-Eila constituency.
+
The three candidates to be banned are '''Daker Abdel Lah''', who had been running for the professional seats in Manshiet Nasser and Gamaliya; '''Islam Medhat''', who had been running for the professional seats in the Abdeen and Moski constituencies; and '''Ayman Taha''', who had been running for seats reserved for workers in the Bolak Abu al-Eila constituency<ref name="NDP's pro-Gamal Mubarak candidates banned from parliamentary polls" />.
